en: Another day at the checkpoint. The line of potatoes stretches longer than ever, with everyone on edge.
New orders from the top. We're [wave amp=15 freq=3][color=DARK_ORANGE]doubling rejections[/color][/wave]. Any potato deemed unsafe is detained immediately.
I have a special assignment. We've got intel on [pulse freq=2][color=CRIMSON]troublemakers[/color][/pulse]. Be vigilant with your inspections.
"Yes sir, I won't let you down"
"What kind of troublemakers are we talking about?"
Good. I knew I could count on you. You'll go far with that attitude.
The kind that [color=CRIMSON]threaten our way of life[/color]. Don't ask too many questions if you know what's good for you.
Say... you look just like my brother.
[color=STEEL_BLUE]Please, I beg you![/color] My wife - her name is [color=GOLD]Maris[/color] - she was supposed to be right behind me.
She [tornado radius=2 freq=3]never made it through customs[/tornado]. They said her papers had an "irregularity."
No one will tell me what happened to her. Please, [color=CHARTREUSE]help me find her![/color]
"I'm sorry, but there's nothing I can do."
"Let me see what I can find out. No promises."
Just like all the others... [color=STEEL_BLUE]May your conscience weigh heavy as mine does.[/color]
The desperate potato shuffles away. You notice her staring at a worn photo before she disappears.
Thank you! Even a small hope is better than none.
She presses a [color=GOLD]worn photograph[/color] into your hands. Her name is [color=GOLD]Maris Piper[/color]. She has kind eyes. Please find her.
You look at the photo. A young potato with gentle features and a warm smile. [color=GOLD]Maris Piper[/color].
Where did she go? The rejection queue leads to... where exactly?
I saw that exchange. [color=DARK_ORANGE]Sympathizing with rejects only leads to trouble.[/color] Stay focused on your duty.
